Latter Days is a very, VERY independent movie. And compared to many of today's more modern films, it's lacking on many parts. The shooting budget was very cheap and the overall movie has an amateurish quality to it. Casting wise, the acting is almost painful looking at it from a big Hollywood studio point of view (actors like one Shane Fellows seem way underdeveloped for his portrayal), but I guess that's sorta expected in an indie flick.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on his friendship with a thief called Musashi, the film takes place at the beginning of the Showa period when Japan was undergoing rapid change from Meiji era isolationism to aggressive militarism.

Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
